Informed consent:
PARTICIPANT INFORMED CONSENT STATEMENT

Study Title:- Discretionary Learning: The Role of Stakeholders, Employers, Line Managers and Workplace mentors in Apprentice and Organisational Success in a post C-19 economy.

You are invited to participate in this research study as a current/former Graduate Apprentice. This study examines how workplace support and learning opportunities influence apprenticeship success and organisational outcomes in the post-pandemic environment.
Your participation involves:

Completing a brief online survey (approximately 15-20 minutes).

Participation is entirely voluntary. You may withdraw at any time without penalty. Your responses will be anonymised and stored securely. Data will be used for research purposes only and findings may be published in academic journals or presented at conferences. No identifiable information will be shared.


Benefits include contributing to the understanding of graduate apprenticeship programs and potentially improving future workplace learning experiences.


For questions or concerns about this study, please contact [Elaine Jackson at Elaine.Jackson@uws.ac.uk].


By proceeding, you confirm that:

-You understand the study's purpose and your role

-You consent to participate voluntarily

-You agree to your anonymised data being used for research

-You know you can withdraw at any time

-You are aged 18 or over


This study has been approved by [UWS Ethics Committee reference number:2024-22949-17935].
